turn.0: ELI5: When nearly all animals use fat as their primary source of fuel, why do dietary guidelines advise a diet based on carbohydrates for human beings?
turn.1: So people should cut down on fats instead of carbs? What about healthy fats like those found in avocados are those any different?
turn.2: What I've heard is:  1. Do High Carb Low Fat 2. Do Low Carb High Fat 3. Never do High Carb High Fat because that messes with the insulin response.
turn.3: I wonder which works best with fasting
turn.4: My guess is that with Low Carb High Fat you're already in ketosis, so no need for fasting.  I think fasting is more useful if you're eating High Carb Low Fat, because in this diet you're using glucose instead of ketones.
turn.5: Thanks man for the learning experience there is a lot of misinformation about diets and what works best good to know
turn.6: No prob man, we're all victims of misinformation, have to keep experimenting to see what works best in each individual case.
